returns._0: value USD value of the token amount.

params.amount: Token amount (assumed to be in 1e18 format).

returns.positionValue: The USD value of the wrapped token.

returns._0: bool True if supported, false otherwise.

isWrappedTokenSupported(address,uint256).details: This is specific to the Blueberry protocol's ERC1155 wrappers (e.g., WERC20).

returns._0: bool True if the underlying token is supported, false otherwise

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

params.oracleRoutes: Array of oracle addresses corresponding to each token.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

routes.details: Mapping from token to oracle routes. => Aggregator | LP Oracle | AdapterOracle ...

INPUT_ARRAY_MISMATCH().notice: Thrown when the lengths of input arrays do not match.

NO_ORACLE_ROUTE(address).notice: Thrown when there is no route to fetch data for the oracle

PRICE_FAILED(address).notice: Thrown when the price fetch process fails for a token.

ZERO_ADDRESS().notice: Thrown when the address provided is the zero address.

SetRoute(address,address).notice: Event emitted when the owner sets a new oracle route for a given token.

getPrice(address).notice: Fetches the price of the given token in USD with 18 decimals precision.

getTokenValue(address,uint256).notice: Fetches the USD value of the specified amount of a token.

getWrappedTokenValue(address,uint256,uin.notice: Calculates the USD value of wrapped ERC1155 tokens.

isTokenSupported(address).notice: Checks if the oracle supports the given ERC20 token.

isWrappedTokenSupported(address,uint256).notice: Determines if the oracle supports the underlying token of a given wrapped token.

pause().notice: Pauses the contract. This function can only be called by the owner.

setRoutes(address[],address[]).notice: Register oracle routes for specific tokens.

unpause().notice: Unpauses the contract. This function can only be called by the owner.

userdoc.notice: This oracle contract provides reliable price feeds to the Bank contract. It maintains a registry of routes pointing to price feed sources. The price feed sources can be aggregators, liquidity pool oracles, or any other custom oracles that conform to the `IBaseOracle` interface.
